alert.note: Alert for Bakersfield; Buena Vista; Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Coalinga - Avenal; Delano-Wasco-Shafter; Fresno-Clovis; Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Hanford - Corcoran - Lemoore; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Mariposa Madera Foothills; Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; South End San Joaquin Valley; South End Sierra Foothills; Southeast San Joaquin Valley; Visalia - Porterville - Reedley; West Side Mountains South of 198; West Side Mountains north of 198; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 15 at 2:43PM PDT until August 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures 102 to 107 degrees expected. * WHERE...The San Joaquin Valley and Coastal Range. * WHEN...Valid until 11 PM PDT Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur, especially for vulnerable populations, such as the elderly, young children, and those with chronic ailments.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, remain out of the sun, and check on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
